Authors: Gunawan A., Muchardie B.G., Kartika C.
Title: Indonesian millennial segmentation to increase behavioral intention to use language learning apps
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Global Business Marketing, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gunawan, A., Global Business Marketing, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Muchardie, B.G., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kartika, C., Global Business Marketing, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The existence of language learning apps answers the needs and behavior trends of Indonesian millennial. However, the behavioral intention to use language learning apps has not been maximized. The purpose of this study is to explore the factors of Indonesian millennial behavioral intention to use language learning apps, then find out whether those factors influence Indonesian millennial behavioral intention to use language learning apps significantly, and finally identify the Indonesian millennial segmentation in language learning apps industry based on the factors of behavioral intention to use. This research uses both qualitative and quantitative methods. The results of the research show that there are 13 variables that affect Indonesian millennial behavioral intention to use language learning apps; then based on those 13 variables, 3 millennial segments are formed, namely The Thirst Learners Skill segment, The Ease-comfort Seekers segment, and The Worth-it Strivers with different characteristics. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Behavioral intention to use; Language learning apps; Millennial segmentation
Index Keywords: Behavioral intention; Industry based; Language learning; Quantitative method; Information management
